item.title: Local development with Kubernetes
item.description: Lately I’ve been working with Kubernetes in order to provide a self-service deployment platform. This ranges from setting up a production-ready cluster, to figuring out how to fit it in a development workflow. Although it’s getting easier, cheaper and faster to use cloud-provisioned environments for development, it can be a productivity-killer to have the cognitive overhead of dealing with remote hosts and what-not for running your code. Also, when developing Docker containers, we often do not wish to publish them, which can be a pain if you don’t have a private registry already setup.
